usefulItems: large bowl, sealable container, round cake tin (20 cm), baking paper, bowl, wooden skewer, cake board or serving plate, refrigerator, oven
title: Vegan chocolate, raspberry and pistachio layer cake

ingredients.content: 1 lemon, zest only, no white pith
200 g coconut oil, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Preparation
Frosting
Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh cashews and 400 g of the water into it. Set aside to soak for 2 hours.
Drain cashews through simmering basket and set aside. Discard soaking water.
Place lemon zest and juice into mixing bowl and grate <b>15 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add remaining frosting ingredients, including soaked cashews and remaining 15 g water and blend <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a sealable container and place into refrigerator. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Raspberry sauce
Place raspberries and sugar into mixing bowl and blend <b>15 sec/speed 5<b>, <b>increasing speed gradually from speed 5 to speed 10.<b>

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and cook <b>15-20 min/100°C/speed 2<b>, or until sauce has set (see Tips). Transfer into a sealable container, allow to cool to room temperature, then place into refrigerator until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Sponge
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a round cake tin (20 cm) and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh almond milk into it. Add apple cider vinegar and chia seeds and set aside for 3 minutes to activate.
Place sugar into mixing bowl and mill <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place coconut oil into mixing bowl and melt <b>50 sec/60°C/speed 2<b>.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk.<b> Add coffee, vanilla and reserved almond milk mixture and mix <b>4 min/speed 4<b>, until a foamy consistency is achieved. <b>Remove butterfly whisk.<b>

Add flour, cocoa powder, bicarbonate of soda, baking powder, salt and reserved sugar and mix <b>40 sec/speed 2<b>, until smooth. Transfer sponge mixture into prepared tin and bake for 35-40 minutes (180°C), or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Allow to cool completely in tin (overnight is better). Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Assembly
Place pistachios into mixing bowl and crush <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.

Cut cooled cake horizontally into 3 layers. Place one layer onto a cake stand or serving plate. Spread with ⅓ of the frosting, then sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of crushed pistachios. Arrange ⅓ of the fresh rasperries over pistachios.
Gently place second layer of cake over fresh raspberries. Spread with another ⅓ of the frosting, then top with 5 tablespoons of the reserved raspberry sauce and another ⅓ of the fresh raspberries.
Top with final layer of cake and spread top with remaining frosting. Garnish with 2 tablespoons of the crushed pistachios and remaining fresh raspberries, then serve.

hintsAndTricks: If fresh raspberries are not available, you can use frozen, thawed raspberries.

Setting point test: place a saucer into the freezer (5-10 minutes). Place 1 tsp sauce onto the chilled saucer. When cooled, push it with your finger. If the sauce wrinkles, it is ready. If not, continue cooking for up to 5 more minutes, then test again.
Serve leftover raspberry sauce with vanilla ice cream, pancakes or in smoothies.
